settingsPane.description: These settings control CFS (Complete Fair Scheduler) Task Scheduler Settings
settingsPane.name: CFS Settings

checkbox.description: Enabling or Disabling HRTICK high-resolution scheduler ticks to avoid performance regression.
checkbox.name: HRTICK
checkbox.label: HRTICK

checkbox.description: Disabling GENTLE_FAIR_SLEEPERS may give you better UI responsiveness.
checkbox.name: GENTLE_FAIR_SLEEPERS
checkbox.label: GENTLE_FAIR_SLEEPERS

checkbox.description: Using ARCH_POWER enables the use of arm topology power functions instead of generic ones.
checkbox.name: ARCH_POWER
checkbox.label: ARCH_POWER

spinner.description: Changes CFS granularity and latency settings. Using anything other than stock may decrease benchmark scores but will increase UI responsiveness
spinner.name: CFS Tweaks

spinner.description: Sets the CPU Idle Mode. Idle+LPA is the default and recommended for S3.
spinner.name: CPU Idle Mode

spinner.description: Sets the smooth scaling level which prevents ondemand based governors to jump directly to maximum frequency with load spikes. This setting will only change the behavior of ondemand and pegasusq governors.
spinner.name: Smooth Scaling Level

spinner.description: Sets the number of CPUs to be used in hotplugging (only for PegasusQ)
spinner.name: Max CPU Lock

seekBar.description: Sets the sched_mc value which changes the cpu scheduler behaviour for multi-cpu systems. 0 is Samsung kernel's default value which turns sched_mc off. Setting it to 1 means that the first core will be tried to be loaded more and setting it to 2 will bias task wake-ups to semi-idle cpu package for power savings. (default: 0)
seekBar.name: sched_mc

seekBar.description: This is for CPU BUS-FREQ UP-FREQ-Scaling, based on CPU load! default=23%
seekBar.name: busfreq_up_threshold

spinner.description: Sets the CPU undervolting value which will be applied during boot time only. It will not have any effect until you restart your device. Remember: if you change this value and your device doesn't boot you will have to reset extweaks settings using CWM recovery. This value will be applied to all CPU steps before any script or app execution. If you use any script or voltage control app this setting may be overriden by those.
spinner.name: CPU Undervolting

button.description: Use this button to see CPU Voltage that used right now!
button.name: Check Active CPU Voltage
button.label: Check CPU Voltage

spinner.description: Sets the CPU undervolting value which will be applied during boot time only. It will not have any effect until you restart your device. Remember: if you change this value and your device doesn't boot you will have to reset extweaks settings using CWM recovery. This value will be applied to all CPU steps before any script or app execution. If you use any script or voltage control app this setting may be overriden by those.
spinner.name: CPU BUS Undervolting

button.description: Use this button to see CPU BusFreq-Voltage that used right now!
button.name: Check Active CPU BusFreq-Voltage
button.label: Check CPU BusFreq-Voltage

spinner.description: This will set the default CPU governor. Default CPU governor will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution) and can be overriden by later scripts or apps.
spinner.name: Default CPU Governor

settingsPane.description: GPU Frequency Settings. Default frequencies are: MIN FREQ: 160, MAX FREQ: 440MHz. Warning: Changing GPU frequency or voltages may cause lockups or damage on your device.
settingsPane.name: GPUFreq

spinner.description: Changes the MIN (lowest) GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step MIN

spinner.description: Changes the MAX GPU frequency speed
spinner.name: GPU Freq MAX

settingsPane.description: GPU Voltage Levels: The defaults are 775mV, 825mV, 875mV, 925mV, 975mV, 1025mV, 1125mV, 1150mV, 1175mV, 1200mV.
settingsPane.name: GPU Voltage Levels

settingsPane.description: GPU load thresholds to change between frequency steps. Defaults: UP: 90, DOWN: 10.
settingsPane.name: GPU Thresholds

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up to next highest step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down to lowest step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold DOWN

settingsPane.description: Speaker Tuning Settings
settingsPane.name: Speaker Tuning

checkbox.description: Enable speaker tuning for better bass response on main speakers
checkbox.name: Speaker Tuning
checkbox.label: Speaker Tuning

seekBar.description: Speaker Amplification Offset. 0 means stock value. Having too much amplification may cause distortion.
seekBar.name: Speaker Amplification Offset

settingsPane.description: Headphone Amplification Settings
settingsPane.name: Headphone Amplification

seekBar.description: Headphone Amplifier Level (0-63 which corresponds to -57db-6db)
seekBar.name: Headphone Amplifier

settingsPane.description: 3D Effect Settings
settingsPane.name: 3D Effect

spinner.description: 3D effect
spinner.name: 3D Effect

settingsPane.description: EQ Settings
settingsPane.name: EQ Settings

spinner.description: Choose which equalizer settings to use: Presets or Graphical Equalizer.
spinner.name: EQ Presets

settingsPane.description: EQ Presets
settingsPane.name: EQ Presets

spinner.description: Hardware Equalizer Presets
spinner.name: EQ Presets

settingsPane.description: Graphical Equalizer
settingsPane.name: Graphical Equalizer

settingsPane.description: EQ Extras
settingsPane.name: EQ Extras

seekBar.description: This will prevent distortion by decreasing the output volume by the selected amount. Leave it 0 if you do not have a distortion problem.
seekBar.name: Negative Digital Gain

settingsPane.description: Optimization, conversion quality, signal processing and effect settings
settingsPane.name: Other Settings

spinner.description: Tuned WM1811 FLL to generate clock source
spinner.name: FLL Tuning

spinner.description: For 48kHz sample rate, the DAC oversample rate is 128fs when this option is selected, which makes the music sound better.
spinner.name: DAC OverSampling

spinner.description: Bypass analog channel mixer and redirect the sound directly to the output.
spinner.name: dac direct

spinner.description: This forces the output to be mono even if the source is stereo
spinner.name: Force Mono

settingsPane.description: Other screen related settings
settingsPane.name: Other Settings

checkbox.description: mDNIe sharpness tweaks from hardcore. Requires reboot to be effective.
checkbox.name: mDNIe Sharpness Tweaks
checkbox.label: mDNIe Sharpness Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enables or disables the mechanic, disabled by default
checkbox.name: LCDfreq_enable
checkbox.label: Dynamic Screen Frequency Scaling for PeqasusQ

checkbox.description: Enables or disables the mechanic, disabled by default
checkbox.name: LCDfreq_enable
checkbox.label: Dynamic Screen Frequency Scaling For ondemand

seekBar.description: Setting min_bl higher will result in staying lowest brightness level for brighter conditions (default 30)
seekBar.name: min_bl

spinner.description: Set CPU freq boost level when you touch the screen. Lower levels will help with the battery with the cost of UI lags
spinner.name: Touch Boost Level

settingsPane.description: Here you can control kernel screen gestures, set at /data/gesture_set.sh. More can be added by user. This tweak depends on cortex background service to be ON
settingsPane.name: Gestures Panel

checkbox.description: Here you can turn on/off kernel built in gestures! See OP for instructions/ask in forum.
checkbox.name: Gestures switch
checkbox.label: GESTURES SWITCH

button.description: Click to reset gestures to default, or update with new one from dev. Gesture file will be added to `/data/` only if it is missing.
button.name: RESET GESTURES
button.label: Reset Gestures

settingsPane.description: Here you can run Fix Permissions, Zipalign, DB Optimization script's with one click! please click one time only, scripts will finish in 2~3Min max, no reboot needed.
settingsPane.name: FIX PERMISIONS + ZIPALIGN + DB OPTIMIZE

button.description: Click here to start fixing.
button.name: FIX PERMISSIONS
button.label: FIX PERMISSIONS

button.description: Click here to start Zipalign ONLY User apps, system may be unresponsive, it's OK, do not use phone for 2Min.
button.name: ZIPALIGN
button.label: ZIPALIGN ALL APPS

button.description: Click here to start Apps DataBase's Optimization, compacting, cleaning and reindexing, will take 2min max.
button.name: DB OPTIMIZATION
button.label: DATABASE OPTIMIZATON

settingsPane.description: Misc Settings
settingsPane.name: Misc Settings

spinner.description: WIFI supplicant scan interval, here you can set the time in sec for WIFI to look for access points when ON, Higher the range, less battery used by WIFI! but if you want WIFI to be off on screen OFF, and you set it in ROM settings!, then set it 60sec, if cortex process ON then no problem, will be set by auto and set your setting on screen ON to 360sec and off to 60sec!
spinner.name: WIFI supplicant scan interval

checkbox.description: Here you can Allow WIFI to use full PWR when screen is OFF, by default we use LOW PWR and get slow speed on wifi transfers, Only when screen is OFF, checked=LOW PWR, not checked=HIGH PWR
checkbox.name: WIFI LOW POWER SWITCH
checkbox.label: WIFI LOW PWR

checkbox.description: Enables or disables the mechanic, disabled by default. Lets the hypervisor system share identical memory pages amongst different processes or virtualized guests. This is done by scanning through the memory finding duplicate page.
checkbox.name: KSM_enable
checkbox.label: Kernel SamePage Merging

checkbox.description: Sys kernel interface to configure linux printk logging.
checkbox.name: Linux printk logging
checkbox.label: Linux printk logging enable or disable

spinner.description: GPS Time Zone for faster LOCK! Use your region to fix GPS location!
spinner.name: GPS Region

button.description: Click to see your current GPS ZONE
button.name: GPS ZONE
button.label: GPS ZONE CHECK

spinner.description: ZRAM (Compressed swap space in RAM) size
spinner.name: ZRAM Size

button.description: ZRAM check for active state
button.name: ZRAM STATS
button.label: ZRAM STATS

button.description: Update time via ntp-server
button.name: UPDATE TIME
button.label: UPDATE TIME

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable Android Logger (needs reboot)
checkbox.name: Android Logger
checkbox.label: Android Logger

spinner.description: This will set the default I/O scheduler. Default I/O scheduler will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution) and can be overriden by later scripts or apps.
spinner.name: Default I/O Scheduler

spinner.description: This will set the STANDBY/DEEPSLEEP I/O scheduler for internal, system, data and external sdcard. Default is NOOP
spinner.name: STANDBY/DEEPSLEEP I/O Scheduler

spinner.description: This will set the default I/O scheduler Read_Ahead. Default I/O scheduler Read Ahead will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution) and can be overriden by later scripts or apps.
spinner.name: Default I/O Scheduler Read Ahead

spinner.description: Change USB connection mode. Either leave it as default or force it to mass storage mode (you will see your sdcards as disks) or mtp
spinner.name: USB Mass Storage Mode

spinner.description: Charge current setting
spinner.name: Charge Current

spinnerItem.name: AC/Misc:750mA, USB:650mA(For normal charger and USB2.0 max)
AC/Misc:1200mA, USB:900mA(risky, may overheat if phone used and only for fast charger and USB3.0)

button.description: Clean the media cache on your sdcard. Push once to clean, push again to abort. You have to reboot for action to work!
button.name: Clean media-cache
button.label: FIX MEDIA ON/OFF

button.description: Clean WIFI DHCP IP Lease. Push the botton to activate!
button.name: Clean WIFI Lease
button.label: Clean WIFI Lease

settingsPane.description: Removing/Reinstalling root to support some apps which requires you not to have a rooted phone.
settingsPane.name: Remove/Reinstall Root

button.description: Removes su and Superuser.apk files from the system partition
button.name: Remove Root
button.label: Remove Root

checkbox.description: If checked, installs root on the next reboot.
checkbox.name: Auto-Install Root
checkbox.label: Auto-Install Root

settingsPane.description: Here you can Add/Update/Remove AD Blocker! `You need ROOT to do the tweak!` if we update the blocker, you can push the `UPDATE AD NOW`, to get the new one installed!, if you install new ROM, and want to use AD BLOCKER, then push `UPDATE AD NOW` and REBOOT, if you need to REMOVE AD-B use the REMOVE button and REBOOT
settingsPane.name: AD Blocker menu.

button.description: ADD/UPDATE AD BLOCKER
button.name: AD-B UPDATE/ADD
button.label: UPDATE AD-B NOW

button.description: REMOVE AD Blocker
button.name: AD-B REMOVE
button.label: REMOVE AD-B NOW

settingsPane.description: Here you can activate Auto system: clean, tune, reconfig, resync, and much more
settingsPane.name: CRON TASKS MENU

spinner.description: Main Switch for CRON TASKER ON/OFF. If set to OFF, then all tasks below have no effect!
spinner.name: CRON TASK MAIN SWITCH

button.description: Use this button to test if Cron Task Service is ONLINE and supported! If main switch is ON, and service is OFFLINE, then ROM Busybox is not supporting CRON. Update Busybox or ROM for this to work.
button.name: Test Cron Task Service
button.label: Test Cron Task Service

button.description: Use this button to RESET Cron scripts and jobs from kernel to refresh the configuration, This will clear all custom changes!
button.name: CRON Function Reset
button.label: Reset Cron Files

checkbox.description: Cron Task to clear RAM Cache/Buffers every HOUR only if CPU is resting(IDLE)! this will free RAM from buffers and not used cache
checkbox.name: RAM Cache Clean Task
checkbox.label: RAM Cache Clean Every Hour

checkbox.description: Cron Task to update AD BLOCKER every week at SAT 6:00AM UTC time, from official site. task will check if internel is connected, if not will try to use WIFI! script will turn wifi wait for connection and update, when finish will turn WIFI off. if not connection, will write error in log
checkbox.name: Update AD Block every week
checkbox.label: Update AD Block every week

checkbox.description: Cron Task to clear APP cache every 4:00AM only if CPU is resting(IDLE)! this can maintain free space on data partition, and clean all old junk.
checkbox.name: DISK Clean Task
checkbox.label: DISK Clean Task Every 4:00AM

checkbox.description: Cron Task to FIX APPS Permissions every 4:40AM only if CPU is resting(IDLE)! this can help to reduce errors, bugs, and applications FC.
checkbox.name: Permissions Fix Task
checkbox.label: Permissions Fix Task Every 4:40AM

checkbox.description: Cron Task to Zipalign all DATA APPS every 4:50AM only if CPU is resting(IDLE)! This can help to reduce errors, bugs, applications FC, and improve applications load speed. Backup all apps before use! This process will remove apps that are BROKEN and not compressed or compiled correctly, so you may find some apps missing. Use it at your own risk and update the broken Apps!
checkbox.name: Zipalign Task
checkbox.label: Zipalign Task Every 4:50AM

button.description: Use this button to check if Cron Task Jobs are done as requested. This will show the log for all finished jobs.
button.name: Test Cron Task Jobs
button.label: Test Cron Task Jobs

settingsPane.description: Dual-Boot Settings. Warning: No confirmation will be asked for reboot buttons.
settingsPane.name: Dual-Boot Settings

button.description: Reboot into 2ndROM Utils which let you configure, clone or backup the 2ndROM
button.name: Reboot into 2ndROM Utils
button.label: Reboot into 2ndROM Utils

button.description: Reboot into 1stROM
button.name: Reboot into 1stROM
button.label: Reboot into 1stROM

button.description: Reboot into 2ndROM
button.name: Reboot into 2ndROM
button.label: Reboot into 2ndROM

checkbox.description: Check this if you don't want boot logo to be shown. If this options is checked boot logo will not be shown even if you have 2ndROM installed.
checkbox.name: No boot-logo
checkbox.label: No boot-logo

spinner.description: Default ROM to boot into. If you don't have 2ndROM installation 1stROM will be booted. If you press the home or volume-down buttons during the boot logo the alternative ROM will be booted, i.e. 1stROM will be booted if the default ROM selection is the 2ndROM.
spinner.name: Default ROM

settingsPane.description: Here you can manage cortexbrain-tune script
settingsPane.name: Automation Script tuning.

spinner.description: Enable or Disable the "background-process" from "cortexbrain-tune.sh". If you disable it, you will you lose kernel AI that maintains your device. After enabling it, wait 2sec, then push the "CHECK SERVICE" button to see if service is online.
spinner.name: Cortexbrain-Background-Process

button.description: Cortex service checker. Click to see if Cortexbrain 'background-process' is running or not
button.name: CORTEX Service check
button.label: CHECK SERVICE

spinner.description: Here you can control android logger "logcat". If you set it to AUTO, then you will have logs only on screen is on. When screen will be off, logger will be disabled to save battery. If you set DEBUG, it will be working no matter what! If set to DISABLED, logging will be off, no matter what. The tweak depends on Cortexbrain to be enabled. If USB/Charger is connected and logger is set to AUTO, logging will not be disabled so we can debug.
spinner.name: Android Logger control

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable "Auto-Brightness" function. Depends on Cortexbrain-Background-Process!
checkbox.name: Auto-Brightness
checkbox.label: Force Auto-Brightness

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable "Firewall-Tweaks". (To update after change REBOOT)
checkbox.name: Firewall-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Firewall-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable "TCP-Tweaks". (To update after change REBOOT)
checkbox.name: TCP-Tweaks
checkbox.label: TCP-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable "IPv6 Network". (Default is OFF. To update after change, turn OFF screen and then turn it ON after 3sec!)
checkbox.name: IPv6 Tweaks
checkbox.label: IPv6

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable "CPU-Tweaks". (To update after change, turn OFF screen and turn it ON after 3sec!)
checkbox.name: CPU-Tweaks
checkbox.label: CPU-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable "Memory-Tweaks". (To update after change REBOOT)
checkbox.name: Memory-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Memory-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable "Battery-Tweaks". (To update after change REBOOT)
checkbox.name: Battery-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Battery-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable "System-Tweak". (To update after change REBOOT)
checkbox.name: System-Tweaks
checkbox.label: System-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable "Kernel-Tweaks". (To update after change REBOOT)
checkbox.name: Kernel-Tweaks
checkbox.label: Kernel-Tweaks

checkbox.description: Enable or Disable "I/O-Tweaks". (To update after change REBOOT)
checkbox.name: I/O-Tweaks
checkbox.label: I/O-Tweaks

settingsPane.description: Debug to SD-Card (/sdcard) ...
settingsPane.name: Bug-Report

button.description: Bug-Report for Kernel
button.name: Kernel-Bug
button.label: KERNEL-BUG

button.description: Bug-Report for Apps
button.name: App-Bug
